item.title: 'Relief' as cop charged with assaulting protester named

item.title: NSW Premier Chris Minns confirms $60 weekly toll cap will continue, but major Harbour Bridge change could pay
item.description: <p>NSW Premier Chris Minns has revealed the state&#x27;s $60 a week toll cap will continue beyond January 1 to help motorists with the cost-of-living.</p>

item.title: Sand with asbestos fears reported at than 300 schools in South Australia
item.description: <p>Asbestos has been detected in imported colourful &quot;kinetic&quot; sand used for play in state kindergartens, primary schools, high schools and early childhood centres across the state.</p>

item.title: Cambridge Dictionary named its word of the year for 2025 as 'parasocial'
item.description: <p>Cambridge Dictionary has named its word of the year for 2025, alighting on &quot;parasocial,&quot; used to describe a connection that people feel with someone they don&#x27;t know or even with an artificial intelligence.</p>

item.title: Police shoot man armed with knife in Far North Queensland
item.description: <p>A man is in a critical condition after he was shot by police this morning in Kanimbla, Cairns.</p>

item.title: Series of 'sliding doors' moments could have prevented skydiver deaths, court told
item.description: <p>A series of small &quot;sliding doors&quot; moments could have prevented the deaths of two skydivers, who fell after they became entangled on a plane mid-air during a catastrophic jump, a court has been told.</p>

item.title: Nut allergy to brain injury: what happened to Max?

item.description: <p>Lachlan Young, 23, ignored a packed Ballarat courtroom, instead staring straight ahead as Victorian Supreme Court Justice James Elliott sentenced him today.</p>

item.description: <p>Arnie the German Shepherd was asleep in the tray of Nathan McKeown&#x27;s ute on Davidson Street in Wynnum on November 8.</p>
